website_summaries.verdict: A powerful, clean, quiet, and low-maintenance alternative to gas-powered mowers.
pros: straight and provide enough gusto to cut through thick grass
Quite simple to assemble and get going, with its efficient battery life
Also stores easily for its size

customer_reviews.title: Buy this thing if you don’t care about safety!.
customer_reviews.text: This a cheaply built product that die very quickly. After the second time mowing, the blade went flying and it’s stripped out the The bolt that holds everything in place underneath. Luckily no one was hurt but buyer beware.
customer_reviews.author: Eneill75

customer_reviews.title: Great in beginning. 1 year later battery is garbage
customer_reviews.text: Lawn mower works great. Battery held charger for perfectly in the beginning. The battery has greatly diminished amd now will not hold a charge past 2 green light. Very irritating.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Dead after just a few mins use, new out of box
customer_reviews.text: Dead out of box, battery full charge before use. Cut one line about 30yds long, stop to go get my sunglasses, come back and it wouldn’t start again. Will return and get a different brand, may be corded.
customer_reviews.author: Domo

customer_reviews.title: Poor Battery Life: 6 charges for most of 1/4 acre yard
customer_reviews.text: Really bad battery life. Charged both batteries six times just for a 1/4 acre yard. I couldn’t even finish the last 900 sq ft unless I charged them both a 7th time. That was final straw and I returned it. Otherwise I liked the mower but not worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Hersh

customer_reviews.title: No battery life.  Useless mower.
customer_reviews.text: Completely useless. I have used 6. SIX FULLY CHARGED battieries and still haven’t been able to finish cutting my front yard. I read reviews that the battery lasted an hour. Do not buy this mower if you have more than 10 minutes of mowing to do. Each battery lasts about that long. It’s horrible and a complete waste of my money and my time!!!
customer_reviews.author: D. Robertshaw

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy it
customer_reviews.text: The lawnmower has only worked once. There is no way to have it repaired because there is no representation in the US. Customer service was not helpful. I have a $600.- headache.
customer_reviews.author: Christiana Acree

customer_reviews.title: Crappy for the price
customer_reviews.text: This thing sucks. The shoot is too narrow so the grass clumps every three feet and I have to clear it constantly. Plus the motor can’t handle a close cut so I can’t do anything shorter than the 3 inch setting. Ugh! So frustrating. I have my tricks that help a little but for the price I shouldn’t have to make my own adjustments just to save myself from having to clear the shoot every THREE FEET! Way too expensive for the poor quality mowing experience.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: arrived broken...the brackets holding the power unit to the mower need to be improved
customer_reviews.text: The mower was apparently dropped en-route. The company was difficult to work with. I decided to go with a refund. The top unit that holds the battery is fairly heavy when the battery is in place. It is held to the bottom motor unit with 4 plastic elbows...two of them were broken off in my unit. Does not look like a safe design. I will wait until I see a more sturdy mower on the market.
customer_reviews.author: milroyjoe

customer_reviews.title: Broke after one month
customer_reviews.text: Broke after one month, they wanted me to drive an hour to get it repaired.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: This mower handled everything I threw at it.
customer_reviews.text: I moved to Mississippi and the lot is5 acres. I thought I would mow just about 1/2 acre with this mower. I ended up moving almost 2 acres with it for several months till I could afford the rider I wanted. I could not believe that it worked and lasted that long. It is still working good just need new batteries. In the beginning they lasted almost an hour each but now I am lucky to get 20 minutes out of them. That is after 2 summers in Mississippi mowing about 12 hours a week. You may want to buy an extra battery if you are going to mow more than 3 hours with it.
customer_reviews.author: Computer Tune-Up

customer_reviews.title: OK, we have it only a few weeks, so take that into consideration.
customer_reviews.text: We have had a corded Greenworks for two years. Someone ran over a water main access! So, it was my chance to buy an 80V cordless. We have also purchased a snowblower with 80v. Power to spare. It a apears they are not going to produce 80V. So, I have quickly bought an 80v snowblower. Only have had it a couple weeks, but it is performing well. This is our 3rd Greenworks. Very satisfied . As I side note I do a lot of research online. Which is why I am an Amazon fan.
customer_reviews.author: Curt

customer_reviews.title: I had battery charger issues immediately after plugging it in ...
customer_reviews.text: I had battery charger issues immediately after plugging it in. The customer service takes forever to get through. I called twice yesterday and was hung up on both occasions. I have tried to register for the warranty online with little success. The machine is bulky and very hard to push. Trying to call customer service to get replacement batteries, I finally got through. A replacement charger was sent. The runtime on this mower is not great. I can barely get through my front or backyard with one battery. Think twice before buying. I had high hopes for this product and it has disappointed majority. The blade isn't strong quality either. This mower is meant for tiny yards only.
customer_reviews.author: Sweet Lew

customer_reviews.title: Mulched like a pro.  I'll never rake leaves again
customer_reviews.text: My first electric lawn mower. Very happy do far. I've only used it to mulch leaves this winter. Looking forward to using it this spring. So far battery has lasted for longer than I needed to.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Stewart

customer_reviews.title: Zero Emissions, Zero Problems
customer_reviews.text: I own a Greenworks Snow Blower which uses the same 80V batteries. This mower replaces a Craftsman self-propelled gas mower. The Greenworks is light and does a great job. I have a small front lawn with lush grass, and a larger back lawn which is uneven due to a large elm tree. I had no problems going through the grass which was a week-and-a-half overdue. My wife pushed it around (she thought I needed a self-propelled mower) and she had no issues with it either. The mower works great, has zero emissions, and I don't nee to purchase gas and oil. All of my lawn tools are now electric which is fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Beware - Not as Described
customer_reviews.text: Ignore the inflated review score. Read the actual reviews. This mower doesnt perform as described... Not even close. I bought a smaller model but immediately had battery life issues so I thought Id give the company a second chance and upgrade. Bad choice. This mower lasts about 10 minutes on a fully charged battery. And whats even worse, even during that 10 minutes, the bag doesnt collect hardly any grass! Sure, it cuts alright while its running. But a 30 or 40 minute job becomes an all day struggle with this machine
customer_reviews.author: amy  friend

customer_reviews.title: Gas-like power!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to push but not self propelled. But my husband prefers it because less battery is used. The package is perfect because it has two batteries so great value. I use the tractor to mow the yard and he uses this mower to go around the trees and fence. He LOVES it! Battery life is as advertised. Even cutting power until end of battery. Battery charges quickly. Quiet, no ear plugs needed. Handles fold easily for storage. He is a spine surgeon so he doesn’t recommend hanging it because it isn’t that light weight and a bit awkward to hang. He is very happy never to redo a carburetor again!
customer_reviews.author: VERY particular buyer

customer_reviews.title: Dont do it.
customer_reviews.text: Batteries run out after 15 MINUTES of mowing.. And tanks about 30 to charge. Worst $500 I've ever spent! Will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: Grace Mathis

customer_reviews.title: Go green
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't be much happier with this product after one year. Very well designed product. It cuts every bit as well as a gas mower. The battery lasts one-hour plus, which is about how long I last as well :) It then takes one-hour minus to charge, which is about how long I need to recharge :) Point is: the fact that this mower is battery-powered turns out not to be an inconvenience to me at all. I love that it is lighter-weight, maintenance free, requires no gas or oil and is eco-friendly. Changed my whole way of thinking about battery-powered outdoor equipment. I have an overhauled gas mower in my garage sitting idle -- I never use it.
customer_reviews.author: Runway Lights

customer_reviews.title: NOT a 21" Mower
customer_reviews.text: Umm - complaints 1st, then the compliments: Can the marketing department get away with advertising a 21 inch "deck", but actually the blade is only 20 inches? Well, I guess so, since that's what's happening here. Because of this, the overlap needed after each path needs to be a bit more than you would guess at first. Handle feels a bit flimsy/flexy, but not too much so. Would like to be able to manually select blade speed, instead of the "load" determining the speed. Compliments: Mower is light and easily manuvered Plenty of power. Bags the clipping better than my Honda mower Folds up compactly and is able to store on end for small footprint. Quiet No gas!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Lawnmower GREAT  Trimmer is junk
customer_reviews.text: I liked the lawn mower so much that I bought their trimmer. What a mistake. The nylon double cord for the trimmer requires an engineer with 3 hands to load more cutting material. The two speed control is VERY FAST or VERY VERY VERY fast which tears up everything it comes in contact with including what you do not want to tear up. The unit itself is quite light weight but when you add the battery it ways WAY WAY too much to use for any length of time. After a great buy on the electric mower, the trimmer was a LARGE mistake and is badly engineered.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Cuddihy

customer_reviews.title: Works great, I have back problems
customer_reviews.text: Compared to my gas mower, this machine is SO much lighter. I have back problems and cutting my grass is hard on my body (push mower only). This one allows me to get cutting done faster and I can maneuver it easily. The battery lasts about an hour, so I charge one while I’m using the mower so I can switch them out and keep going. The box is SUPER heavy when shipped to your house, so you’ll want help moving it. It’s easy to put together and starts right up. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mower, lots of power, quiet and perfect choice
customer_reviews.text: I retired my 6.5 horsepower push mower and wanted something that was quieter, didn't require gas or oil and didn't want to sacrifice power. I had new sod and let my neighbor borrow this mower, he went out the next day and bought one. I've mowed 4 times and had to charge once with the 4 AH battery. I admit we have a pretty small yard but the 4 AH should easily handle ~ a 1/2 acre lot. I will be picking up the other 80 volt tools.
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: Best lawn mower I have ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: OH MY GOD! This machine is amazing - My grass had practically turned to hay and this mower chomped it down without a problem from about 18" height. The charge lasted almost a full hour, even with the machine using higher revs due to the long wet grass that was being cut. You can easily carry on a normal conversation over the noise of this mower, no raised voices needed. The height adjustment is sturdy and offers a good range for cutting. Easy on/off mower/mulcher bag, the battery has excellent access and slides in and out easily, without compromising a good secure fit when in use. I am very impressed with this machine
customer_reviews.author: Terence C.

customer_reviews.title: High Quality - great workmanship
customer_reviews.text: I have a riding mower and this makes the perfect companion to that. What I am most impressed with is that the charging rate of one battery is almost exactly the same as the discharge rate of the other. I live in a pretty rocky area and sometimes mow over some huge rock. This thing shows no signs of wear when I do this. If the object locks up the blade, the unit shuts downs...I move it to a dofferent place and it starts right up immediately. I am a huge fan of this company and their workmanship. I just ordered a couple more items from them.
customer_reviews.author: Phil Peretz

customer_reviews.title: amazing product, I love it!
customer_reviews.text: It's quiet, it does an amazing job cutting and mulching the grass, no more gas, no more oil, no more maintenance! This is a 10 out of 10 lawnmower, I am a happy person!
customer_reviews.author: Steven R.

customer_reviews.title: I would say batter powered mowers have arrived.
customer_reviews.text: I was hoping my 17 year old Honda gas mower would get me by until the battery powered electric mowers came of age. Now that the engine seized, I had to make a decision: either jump into the battery world or buy an engine. After watching a bunch of YouTube reviews, I went for this guy. And I am very happy with it. I have a big yard with lots of obstacles, so the corded electrics are not a very good option. I'm guessing these will just keep getting better, but if you gas mower dies, I'd definitely get this.
customer_reviews.author: Don M. Paluh

customer_reviews.title: Better than I Expected!
customer_reviews.text: This is my first battery-powered mower. I have used this for several weeks now, and I am impressed by the power and quality of cut. I was also pleasantly surprised to see that the unit ups power as needed (such as when you are cutting taller or thicker sections of grass). I am glad that I went for an 80V system like this. It is great to have two batteries and they charge fairly quickly (30 minutes or so). Very pleased with the purchase!
customer_reviews.author: nelsbyu

customer_reviews.title: Works Well and Compact
customer_reviews.text: It is very well made and is easy to store/park in the garage. We have very limited space in the garage but it folds upright and takes the space of about two vacuum cleaners side by side. That is why it suits us very well. Further, one battery lasts about 30 minutes and the spare battery gets charged in the same time. Therefore, one can use it virtually uninterrupted.
customer_reviews.author: RadioFan

customer_reviews.title: Works Great!
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this mower and am very happy with it. The package all arrived in good shape. I have a little more than 1/4 acre. Was able to mow the entire yard on a single charge. It takes ~40 mins to mow my front and back yards, and there was still plenty of charge left in the battery after I was done. Works Great! Fantastic battery life and quick recharge. Cons: The side discharge shute falls off. It's easy to reattach but it's quite a pain in the backside to have to do that all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Martin

customer_reviews.title: Nice change from dealing with gas & oil. Unfortunately, we can't finish 1/3 of an acre in one charge
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for our 1/3 of an acre property Pros: -------- I like not having to deal with gas engine maintenance, oil, winterizing, and gasoline. My 14-year-old son likes it because it's light. While not self-propelled, it's super light so it's easy to push. My neighbor commented about how quiet it was. Cons: -------- It runs out of charge after 30 minutes (by coincidence, also about the same time the gas mower would run out of gas. The battery is charged in 15-20 minutes, then we can finish the lawn in shortly afterwards.
customer_reviews.author: Robert J. Quinn

customer_reviews.title: Most Impressed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace a 40V model that was wearing out and had no parts/life cycle support. Taking a chance on brand with a longer history that my previous machines maker I gave Greenworks a try. My expectations were met and surpassed, this machine takes care of my 1/4 acre with power to spare. Superbly impressed, and very content with purchase. Highly recommend for those with small(ish) lawns that don't want to deal.with the hassle of gasoline and oil changes.
customer_reviews.author: JWP

customer_reviews.title: Solid Mower
customer_reviews.text: With the 80V 4A battery this mower can easily do my lawn (front and back) without a recharge. Its relatively quiet and easy to push. The battery charges fast. The one improvement I would add is functionality similar to the Black & Decker EdgeMax that funnels grass that is close to an edge/wall/border to the blade. Would definitely buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin

customer_reviews.title: Extremely lightweight and powerful
customer_reviews.text: The Greenworks Pro 21-Inch 80V Cordless Lawn Mower with 4.0 AH Battery Included was very easy to assemble. It is extremely lightweight and powerful, and the power even automatically speeds up when you are mowing extra heavy lawn spots. I don't have to worry about gas and my pull start gas lawn mower was always difficult to start. With this Greenworks Pro 21 battery lawn mower, you just press a button and it starts every time. I never thought a battery lawnmower would be as powerful as a gas engine lawnmower, but I am a believer now. I should have purchased this product years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Hegel

customer_reviews.title: Greenworks works nicely but watch my video!
customer_reviews.text: The mower works well. The brushless design works as described...power increases in more dense areas. It ran out of power before I could finish cutting the lawn. I think it was less than an hour. Had to charge it up to finish. The row of diagnostic lights (see my video) still did not work during the recharge. The primary charging light works fine and the check remaining power button works as well. Overall, this is a good product, but I will be reaching out to the manufacturer about the charging stand and hope they will help me to get those lights working on the diagnostic charger.
customer_reviews.author: Carl R.

customer_reviews.title: (Updated)Brand new and battery won't charge...
customer_reviews.text: Not a good start. It arrived today. It looks to be in good condition & was packed well. Read both instruction booklets. Tried to charge the 80v battery...flashes red. Followed the steps instructions provided if continuous red flashing occurs. Called for assistance & only available Mon-Fri. Needless to say I'm concerned I made a rather expensive mistake with this purchase. I will update my review after I hopefully am able to speak with a representative on Monday. **Update..called Greenworks..on hold maybe 2 mins. Above & beyond helpful. I will update again after my replacement battery arrives ...and I mow my lawn!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... used this for the first time and I'm very satisfied with it
customer_reviews.text: Just used this for the first time and I'm very satisfied with it. I used to have an electric mower and although the cord was annoying, the lack of buying gas and tuneups was worth it. But with the battery I can mow the lawn in less time without managing the cords. Part of my yard is on the other side of a street and stringing the cables was a pain. I got the 4ah battery and after finishing the lawn I had 2/3rds left. The only thing I would do different if I had it to do over was get the two 2ah lighter batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Ken B

customer_reviews.title: Excellent mower
customer_reviews.text: Worked better than expected. It had been months since my yard had been mowed and the mower came on a day when it had been raining all day. I got home from work late and didn't have time to switch it out of mulching mode. Even with wet, tall grass and in mulching mode, it did a great job! The yard looks great. If I started walking faster or went into a thicker area, it would audibly use more power, which was neat. It never stalled and cut the front and back yard with juice to spare. This is more than enough lawn mower for me. So far I'm very happy with my purchase. Hopefully it'll hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Amazons Customers

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for a while now on a nearly 14,000 square foot florida lawn and a smaller lawn for months before that. Had no issues and the 4.0 ah battery will get the job done with a little left over for the 80v edger. Had to charge the battery once when it got a little long and the mower was on the highest speed most of the time.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold a charge as long as it said it would.
customer_reviews.text: This DID NOT hold a charge as long as it said it would. I first bought the one with the 40 volt battery it quickly found out that it dead on me early into mowing. So I took it back then I purchased this one. Hoping to have better luck. NOPE! Maybe if I bought an extra battery, so I could switch out while the other is charging but maybe my yard is just too big. It took four attempts to get my yard completely mowed. I think this would work better for people with patio homes. Also, my yard is flat, and I still had to push a little hard since it isn't self propelled.
customer_reviews.author: Tracey L. Counts

customer_reviews.title: excellent mower
customer_reviews.text: I got it in the fall and have used it mostly to pick up leaves to compost. At this it works better than expected. I love not have to drag around a long cord. I can usually mow my whole lawn on one charge. It takes a few times to get used to how it works faster/harder when you start to go through a tougher section, and then spins slower for light duty. My only minor complaint is the handle you lift up to remove the bag is too thin. Mine broke but they sent a replacement for that one part right away.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Allen

customer_reviews.title: ** BUY ** Cut 10,000 sq ft on a single charge
customer_reviews.text: Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is it's a little heavy compared to most battery powered lawn mowers. Yard is ~8,500 SQ ft and I was able to cut entire yard and almost cut backyard twice on the highest motor setting on a single charge. This was the exact reason I bought this model over others, I wanted amazing range on a single charge- it delivers in that area.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Quite impressed
customer_reviews.text: I’ve always been skeptical of an electric or battery operated lawn mower. Going into my second season with this mower, it holds up quite well. It’s cut through some tall grass that my cheap gas mower would have an issue with. I have a small yard, but can get 2-3 mows out of one battery, depending on how tall the grass is.
customer_reviews.author: Lucas

customer_reviews.title: Best mower I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower. I love the fact that I don’t have to keep gasoline in my garage. The mower is very quite, if I want to mow at 7 in the morning I can do so without bothering my neighbors. It is easy to maneuver. The battery is very long lasting. I do not have a big yard and I easily get 6-8 mows without a recharge. I like it so much I bought the string trimmer as well.
customer_reviews.author: rocrow

customer_reviews.title: Advertised run time is false
customer_reviews.text: Marketing info clearly says good up to 1 acre, but I had to change batteries 3/4 of the way through my 1/4 lot. False advertising.
customer_reviews.author: SharePoint Blackbelt

customer_reviews.title: The best purchase I ever made
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing I had the other one for years and this is more powerful plus I have the backpack blower you just the same battery really easy to mow your lawn and I’m in my 70s no gasoline oil changes no fixing no mess just charge the battery and they charge really quick
customer_reviews.author: Annie

customer_reviews.title: Amazing mower
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best yard tools I have ever purchased. The 80v battery has a lot of power and the second gets me through the yard. Well made and I like the quiet, minimal noise. I also bought the string trimmer. Great tools.
customer_reviews.author: Greg L. Carter

customer_reviews.title: The "best" model couldn't even handle a modest front yard on 2 batteries.
customer_reviews.text: After extensive research on the best electric mower for 3/4 of an acre, Greenworks appeared to be the best buy. However, upon receiving the mower and putting it together (a relatively east task) I found the mower couldn't even handle the entire front yard-- not even a 1/4 acre without having to stop and charge the battery. It came with 2 but I couldn’t mow without constantly recharging. Less than half of my backyard, probably another 1/8 acre needed 3 charges as well. I wanted to do the right thing and eschew a gas mower. I'm now having to rethink my options.
customer_reviews.author: LH

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic mower you won’t be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Awesome mower! I love love love this mower. Never had a electric mower before and now I’ll never go back. Works as good or better then and gas version I’ve owned. It’s super quiet and easy to use. Easy assembly too. I also like the two included batteries that makes a big difference in the event we lose a charge. I have a small yard and can mow 3 or four times without charging.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth

customer_reviews.title: Shipping
customer_reviews.text: Crushed box when delivered. Unpacked it, look ok. But on closer inspection the batter cover was cracked. The mower runs great, easy to use. Who ever packed it just threw it a box and FEDEX didn't do it any favors. JUst bouncing around in the back of a truck. The box should have never left the distribution center looking as it did. This one is on Amazon for the lousy packing.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald O.

customer_reviews.title: Live & Learn
customer_reviews.text: Slammed my finger inbetween the bars while assembling. The 'knobs' (#66) wouldn't tighten & the mower folded in half on NY finger. So not cool. Once assembled it works great. However, even with 2 of the 80V battery vs 20V it still took 5-6 rotations of charging. I 1st purchased the 14" Snow Joe, but it was making me wait until May, so I ordered this. Glad bcz it's 21" vs 14 & had 80V vs 20.. you live & learn
customer_reviews.author: M. G.

customer_reviews.title: The Next Great Thing in Battery-Powered Yard Tools!
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat skeptical that this Greenworks Pro mower could power through my thick grass on a single charge. Boy, was I surprised! It zips through my thick grass like it isn't even there, and when I'm done, only one third of the battery's charge has been used up - two of the three lights on the battery are still lit! I am happier with this purchase than any other I've made this year!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Tough, quiet and the best mower I’ve ever owned!
customer_reviews.text: I love this mower! Really quiet and starts so easily. It does a fabulous job with all kinds of grass, old leaves with some twigs are not a problem either. It’s just like a tough old mower without the noise, stink, and trips to get gas. I completely recommend this mower, have never fully ran a battery down either. I have an average city lot(front,back,side yards). I TRY to store the batteries in the basement when not in use, alas I have teenage boys that mow sometimes and leave the battery in the mower in the hot shed. Zero problems so far!!
customer_reviews.author: Jacki

customer_reviews.title: If your are tired of gasoline, buy this mower.
customer_reviews.text: Great mower, light weight but tough. The handle assembly design could use some work. The bolt is not completely threaded and had to screw on the nut backwards to assemble. Battery charger works quickly and battery life seems adequate for my 15,000 sq ft lot.
customer_reviews.author: Collier Wildlife Supply LLC

customer_reviews.title: A good purchase for a normal sized yard
customer_reviews.text: I love it. It's easy to use and came with 2 batteries so one can charge while the other is in use. The blade came loose after a few uses. I was able to tighten it without much difficulty, but I'll update this if the problem continues. It's relatively quiet.
customer_reviews.author: teach joy

customer_reviews.title: Wife LOVES it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the wife to use because the gas and starting a gas mower where a pain. It was delivered quickly and was easy to put together, literally like 5 minutes. No tools required. Wife loves it. I got the blower, trimmer and chainsaw to complete the set. Very happy with all of these items.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D

customer_reviews.title: Impressed me
customer_reviews.text: I just mowed some pretty thick and wet grass with it and it did better than I expected. I was even mulching the clippings to test it out too. Sounds like a lot of people got the shaft when they purchased this mower, guess I got a good one.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Ease of use, quiet and powerful
customer_reviews.text: No damage when delivered, easy and quick to set it up. I have owned another battery powered lawn mower in the past and loved it. We had a lawn care service while I worked but since retiring decided to do my own garden care again. This lawn mower works great with battery power to spare and is very quiet. No worries about gas and oil. I will look at getting a hedge trimmer by the same company soon. Height adjustment works great for my St. Augustine Florida lawn and my lawn looks better than when it was done "professionally" before and I don't have to worry about weeds being transferred from yard to yard by the lawn care companies equipment.
customer_reviews.author: Mark R. Sortino

customer_reviews.title: The bagging option works great. And I can mow my whole yard with ...
customer_reviews.text: This mower has exceeded my expectations. I was wary about purchasing a battery powered mower but this one is plenty powerful for my .3 acre lot. It tackles high grass, magnolia leaves, and twigs with no problem. The bagging option works great. And I can mow my whole yard with changing the battery once. I mowed with it 5 times now. It is a sturdy unit and plenty powerful for my needs. It's so nice not to have to deal with gasoline and oil and the noise level is substantially lower than a gasoline engine mower.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Quite possibly the best mower I have used
customer_reviews.text: I actually look forward to cutting the grass now that I have this mower. It is great for small to medium yards. It is so nimble, lightweight, easy to maneuver and easy to push. I don't miss my self-propelled gas lawnmower; it was only self propelled to drag its own heavy weight around. It is also quiet enough that I can mow my yard without disturbing the neighbors. Because of almost no vibration, it doesn't leave your arms fatigued.
customer_reviews.author: Robert R.

customer_reviews.title: Easy to handle and battery last to cut whole yard
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 14 year old son who asked to start mowing the yard to make some money. After showing him how to use it and how not to use it he has cut the grass with no issues. After using a gas lawn mower for my whole life I am very happy with how far electric mowers have come. No gas, no oil and no fumes!
customer_reviews.author: Rob

customer_reviews.title: This thing is awesome...!
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, I wasn't too sure about an electrical lawnmower... But I am not disappointed. Battery fully charged in about an hour. Took me just under an hour to finish and The battery stayed above the 50% indicator. Not bad at all. Folds away neatly, isn't too bulky, and it looks cool as hell. Only negative thing I can say about it, is that you can't put the hose to it upon clean up. Or so the manual says. I wouldn't, considering it's electrical and all.. overall excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Lionel Pastrana

customer_reviews.title: Great Electric Mower
customer_reviews.text: This thing just shreds through my tallest grass and speeds up and slows down to cut without losing battery. Its the first electric mower i've used that can cut my whole yard on the 3rd setting. If i take it down to the 2nd setting it just about gets the whole yard. The 4AH batter is definitely more like 2 hours depending on the weather and length of grass.
customer_reviews.author: Spartan F8

customer_reviews.title: Works and quiet, wait fir battery to cool down before recharge.
customer_reviews.text: Does a faily good job. I have about 5000 sq ft of lawn in the front yard requires about 2 batteries to cut and mulch to size 1. Requires 2 2AH 80v batteries to cut to size 2 and bag. Does a decent job but not ptofessionsl quality cut that ny gardener did with a gas powered lawn mower. Great work out in cool nornings in Arizona. Used it 3 times does a decent job and quietly.
customer_reviews.author: HP

customer_reviews.title: JUNK
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been mowing my 1/2 acre of grass for 2 days now and I’m still not done the battery life on these are no where’s near 60 minutes and the 30 minute recharge is a joke, i could mow my grass faster with a goat, this is definitely going back, plus it was supposed to be self propelled, hows that supposed to make the battery last longer, do yourself a favor and stick with a cheap gas mower from tractor supply.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Replaced 34 year old Honda and is a worthy successor
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical about moving to EV/Battery mower due to battery life and strength of cut. After extensive research of many models, this was the one I chose. Really like the brushless motors (life and quiet) along with large battery. Assembly was easy. Lightweight and easy to handle. Cut is beautiful. Self controls speed based on load (aka length of grass) to increase battery longevity. Have mowed my lawn 4 times on original charge. (Lawn is approximately 4,000 sq ft). I was spoiled by the Honda mower I had for 34 years but this is a solid and worthy successor.
customer_reviews.author: jrr

customer_reviews.title: Impressed So Far
customer_reviews.text: After buying their snow blower last fall, I decided to buy the 21" lawn mower. I am replacing my Fiskar push mower. The Fiskar is nice, don't get me wrong. I just wanted to go back to something more traditional. It worked perfect right out of the box. I don't have a huge yard, so either mower worked great. I love the ability to bag the catchings. So far I'm impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Sam W.

customer_reviews.title: Green Dream!
customer_reviews.text: Quieter than my vacuum cleaner! I can use it outside at 7 a.m. without bothering the neighbors or the others in my own household. Slip the freshly charged battery into the slot, depress the bar and tap the start button...and I'm off, getting my double lot mowed in under an hour. Up hill and down, through fern patches and around the grand oaks, changing gear automatically as required. Love this thing, its battery and the charger. No fumes! No yanking at pull strings. This product gets a huge Yes!!! Have used it three times, now. Fun!!!
customer_reviews.author: Keywester1

customer_reviews.title: My wife loves this
customer_reviews.text: My wife loves this because she does not have to pull the cord to start it. We have had two corded electric mowers. Both of them died over time (as we all will, in time). This replacement is much nicer. NO CORD. The battery runs for about an hour. We got a spare. It's well worth the money (be sure to look for it on sale).
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. White

customer_reviews.title: very good replacement for gas mower
customer_reviews.text: Same size as gas mower, same power, same cutting ability, much quieter, nice attachments Charging the batteries is a little inconvenient but my gas mowers never work for more than one year anyways, this is much more energy efficient and likely to last a lot longer. It's really heavy for some people to push though, especially with the clippings bag attached.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Wittik

customer_reviews.title: So happy with my new mower!
customer_reviews.text: After getting rid of two lawn service companies I decided it was time to do my own lawn. When doing research, this product was consistently mentioned as one of the top cordless mowers. So I decided to buy it and wow was I satisfied. This product exceeded expectations. It cuts well and the battery charges quickly and easily lasts long enough to cut my entire lawn. I have about a fifth of an acre of cutting grass to put things in perspective. Why on earth would anyone buy gas mowers moving forward???
customer_reviews.author: Rob A.

customer_reviews.title: ha ha ha !! It works great !!!
customer_reviews.text: Love it , Fought with my girlfriend to see who could mow first !! It is so quiet and easy its fun !!! I just have a normal front yard and it took a whole 10 minutes , fabulous !!!! easy as pie any bad reviews in my opinion are just not telling the truth So easy my 79 year old mom could mow the lawn ! hit start pull handle bar start mowing . you won't be sorry.
customer_reviews.author: John Augustine

customer_reviews.title: So easy to push!
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this mower! I ordered this mower because I liked the idea that it is electric and therefore reduces pollution. My husband became ill, and I knew I needed a mower that I could lift as well as start easily because I had our yard and my mother's yard in town to mow. I was pleased with how long the battery lasted and was able to get the yards mowed using both batteries each time. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This is a true replacement of a gas mower
customer_reviews.text: This mower does everything a good gas mower does without the noise, mess and pollution of a gas mower. The metal body feels better than the all plastic brands. I have had no problem mowing my .3 acre lawn, even wet. It will mow my lawn twice before I need to recharge. My only worry is that there are some sensitive circuits inside and I know that if it gets wet or damaged, the whole mower is junk.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dobbs

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've used it 2 times on my 1/3 acre lawn. First time I did the whole lawn and battery went down to 2 bars. 2nd mow I got through front yard and started backyard when first battery died. No problem, I just grabbed the other fully charged battery, dropped the other on the charger and went back to finish. I thought the weight was going to be an issue but this thing is really light and easy to push. I like that it folds and can stand up straight, makes it easy to keep clean.
customer_reviews.author: Blake W

customer_reviews.title: Works in most environments, but not damp/wet grass
customer_reviews.text: Works great most the time! Does not work well with damp grass; will dump grass out on the lawn and not in the bag when damp. Lasts only a few minutes on a full charge when mowing damp grass. Difficult to use during rainy spring season. Other than that, it works as advertised!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff A. Guth

customer_reviews.title: Very quiet.  Does not constantly die like my gas power mower did
customer_reviews.text: They could make the release bolts a little easier. Other than that. Is does not choke on high grass if I am gone for a week like my gas powered mower does. two neighbors with small children have thanked me for getting such a quiet mower that it does not wake up babies. Not having gas engine seems to have made the mower much lighter than my gas unit.
customer_reviews.author: Mitch

customer_reviews.title: Great mower.
customer_reviews.text: Great buy. Got 4AH batt and it lasts for essentially 1hr mowing efficiently. This is good given the market. the 80V is powerful and the auto-throttling isnt too aggressive to hurt longevity, unless you cut your yard once its become a field or after a rain. 1st one was broken in shipping and replaced quickly. the Batt perch mounts are not all that strong, or UPS handled this like sh**. In any case, has been used on a rut filled yard with roots and hills w/4AH battery. No broken perch. Very pleased. No maintenance going into next season has me excited!
customer_reviews.author: Soup

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this lawn mower (I've been wanting to say that!)
customer_reviews.text: Overall this is a well built machine, very high quality. However, I have two issues that are deal-breakers for me. 1. This is NOT a mulching mower. Partially cut grass comes out from the discharge chute and directly underneath. This forces you to pull the mower backwards over the mounds of grass from the previous cut. 2. The mower has two power modes. However, unless your cutting very short grass AND gong very slowly, it jumps to the high power mode. The lower power is only used when just starting the mower. I would not buy this mower again. Unless you're cutting grass that isn't high enough to cut in the first place,
customer_reviews.author: James D. Seifert

customer_reviews.title: great
customer_reviews.text: had never heard of greenworks. the machine seems to be excellently built of what appear to be heavy duty materials. handsome, in a machinery sort of way, and very bright green. though it only runs about an hour with an 80 volt 4ah battery in heavy grass, it seems to do as a good as my gas powered mower. does an excellent job of "mulching" the clipped grass and is lighter than a gas mower and with its big wheels is easy to push and maneuver. will get another battery.
customer_reviews.author: just  john

customer_reviews.title: Batteries do NOT hold even half of promised charge.
customer_reviews.text: The batteries shipped with this mower do not last 45 minutes, as told in the description. The actual packaging only promises 30 minutes per battery and the reality is neither battery lasts quite 20minutes. This is with basic mowing, following all of the instructions for charging and use.
customer_reviews.author: claire

customer_reviews.title: EAST TO START UP & USE; BATTERY CHARGES QUICKLY, LAST LONG, MOWER HAS GREAT POWER
customer_reviews.text: IT IS GREAT, IT STARTS RIGHT UP, THE BATTERY LAST LONG, IT IS QUIET FOR A LAWN MOWER, CUTS GRASS GREAT, EASY CLEAN UP AND BREAK DOWN TO STORE, SO MUCH CLEANER SMELL THAN A GAS LAWN MOWER, AND ITS NICE NOT TO HAVE TO RUN OUT AND BUY GAS, SO OVER TIME THIS WOULD ALWAYS COME OUT CHEAPER, BEING THAT I SAVE ON GAS EVER RISING COST, & MY TIME
customer_reviews.author: C. SIMMS

customer_reviews.title: but this is the best lawn mower I have ever owned
customer_reviews.text: I don't typically write reviews, but this is the best lawn mower I have ever owned. It has great power, better than my gasoline mower. Even on the smaller battery I was able to mow my entire HALF ACRE yard. A second battery would be nice so that I could keep going with the weed wacker, but it charges so fast it is not necessary. The best part is the variable speed motor that senses the grass and adjusts automatically. It was so quiet and actually enjoyable to mow that my wife saw how much fun I was having and finished mowing the yard for me! Fantastic!
customer_reviews.author: davis

customer_reviews.title: Pet Friendly
customer_reviews.text: The mower is what I expected. It does the job easily with little environmental impact. What I didn't expect was the difference in how my dogs reacted. I have three little dogs that ran for the hills when I started a gas mower. They now follow me around playing when I mow. The electric motor doesn't bother them at all. An unexpected bonus!
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Wow!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Oh yeah. Worthy succseor of gasoline? Yes! Definitely! . This guy far out performs my Ryobi 40v. This mower rocks.the long life battery is a must. For more than a heavy 1/4 acre -- u need two batteries
customer_reviews.author: branden

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: nice height adjustment lever on one wheel does all four at once lots of power use for trimming yard and i have ran battery down yet in one use
customer_reviews.author: Steve McKim

customer_reviews.title: Arrived defective
customer_reviews.text: Extremely upset with this. The metal part that the handle locks into to keep in place is bent out of shape. I contacted Amazon right away, have to contact manufacturer whom of course is using covid to not bother answering customers The box is long gone .. I’d like this fixed!!!
customer_reviews.author: D.V.

customer_reviews.title: The battery runs out too fast
customer_reviews.text: The product is so good but I didn't like the Cordless Lawn's Battery. I will need to buy 2 more batteries
customer_reviews.author: Marcelo Costa

customer_reviews.title: Bad Battery  UPDATE ON MOWER
customer_reviews.text: After the battery disaster was fixed, thanks to Amazons great return process, I can now change my review having used the mower. Changed from 1 star to 4. Mower works great, is quiet and so far I have had zero issues. Great power and cuts like a gas mower. Very happy with the purchase now. Sent me a unit with a bad battery or charger. There is nothing more useless then a battery powered lawn mower without a working battery. 1 star review will stand pending response from company for a (timely) fix of this issue. Will update.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Product
customer_reviews.text: I recently bought this lawn mower, have used it about six times over the last month, and it works really well. I have a 6000 square foot lawn that is very thick and it handles it with ease on one battery. I move relatively fast when mowing, but even if I slowed down I’m sure one battery would do the job. I love the way I can store it upright, love how quiet it is compared to traditional lawn mowers, and love the simple startup process. I will never, ever go back to gas again.
customer_reviews.author: SteveAtAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I will never go back to a gas mower. Mowing used to be a loud, hot, smelly activity. Now, it’s quiet and easy. My 11 year old kids can start the mower without my help, and I never need to worry about pouring gas or checking oil. I considered the self propelled version as I was replacing a self propelled mower, but i’m glad I didn’t. This unit rolls very easily. It’s much lighter than the gas mower it replaced. I think I have more control since it’s not self propelled, and there are fewer parts to wear out. The self propelled unit is what finally broke on my old gas mower, and I won’t have to worry about that.
customer_reviews.author: Sere

customer_reviews.title: Overall best lawn mower I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Love the quiet operation. So do my neighbors! Battery charge will last 3 mowings (2/3 acre property). 80V battery swap-able with other Greenworks tools. ( I have chain saw as well - awesome). Quick charge (<2 hours) after a mowing. Does nice job mowing with sufficient capacity in rear bag.
customer_reviews.author: Mpp58

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: This mower was a vast improvement from what we were used to. The larger tires and lighter weight made for easier mowing and we have four backyard mows under our belt with one charge. I will try for the fifth tomorrow. Electric is the way to go now and we will probably buy the blower/etc attachments. Like this a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Just saying...

customer_reviews.title: We love it!
customer_reviews.text: What a change from our gas mower! So easy to start with just the push of a button instead of breaking my arm pulling the gas mower. It’s so quiet too... you can mow anytime of day. It mulches a million times better than any gas mower I’ve tried. It’s not self propelled and you do need to go slower as to not miss any blades of grass. The 2 batteries are perfect for our 1/4 acre yard. They charge really quickly tho... about 30mins.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor Shunk

customer_reviews.title: 80V Battery. Cuts Well
customer_reviews.text: I have cut the yard twice on one charge with the 4ah battery. It's a dry year so the mower isn't lugging on my small trailer park lot but it's still running strong. Setup is very easy, charge the battery and you're good to go.I like this so much I plan to buy the snow blower this fall.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Plenty of power and quiet
customer_reviews.text: Battery powered lawnmower is.... Awesome!! Still 2 out of 3 bars left on the battery after mowing the whole front yard. Plenty of power and quiet. ￼ It was easy to assemble and started right up. It is light weight and mowed really smooth. I love it. Will get the other tools to go with it next.
customer_reviews.author: P. Logan

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: Glad it came with 2 batteries. Only needed 1 when my grass was short, but when I let the grass grow a little too long, the second battery allowed me to finish the job without a break. I like the light weight, especially when wheeling it around a lot of bushes.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good mower with a horrible battery
customer_reviews.text: The lawn mower itself is great but the battery is worthless. It lasts me about 30 minutes and takes about 90 minutes to charge. Since my lawn takes 45 minutes to mow I now need to charge, mow, charge again and then mow again. My 45 minute lawn now takes about 2 hours. I have a 4.0 AH Battery and replacements are about $150. I would not recommend
customer_reviews.author: Vitaly Romm

customer_reviews.title: Great mower
customer_reviews.text: Have used rechargeable mowers for over 20 years. This mower is by far the most powerful I've ever owned, the battery lasts a long time and can easily be swapped with a second one, and it is incredibly quiet. Extremely happy with this mower and with the leaf blower and chain saw from the same product line.
customer_reviews.author: quietudedude

customer_reviews.title: Perfect lawnmower to make the switch from gas to electric
customer_reviews.text: Perfect lawnmower to make the switch from gas to electric. I bought it along the string trimmer and the snow blower, which were coming with batteries. That was the best deal I could get for everything. So far, it is silent, and one battery is enough to lawn and trim my back and front yards, taking me about 45 minutes. I really have no complaint so far. It comes with the bag and the side panel if you prefer not to pick the grass.
customer_reviews.author: dgiaffe

customer_reviews.title: High tech mowing
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with my new mower. It works as promised and it gives me the added bonus of no further trips to the gas station. It replaces my previous mower, a Sears Craftsmen that I bought when I moved into this house in 1990. I'm not expecting 29 years out of my new purchase, but I intend to enjoy it as long as it lasts. In particular, I love the low noise level that allows me to hear surrounding noises as I mow. The battery lasts as promised and there is always another one charged up and ready to go to finish the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hale

product_meta.title: Greenworks 2501202 Pro 21-Inch Cordless Push Lawn Mower, includes 4Ah Battery and Charger
product_meta.description: Size:4Ah Battery| Style:PushGreenWorks Pro 80V System offers a range of commercial grade tools for the professionals and those who just want more power. This 21-inch cordless lawn mower features a durable steel deck, large 10-inch rear wheels, and Smart Cut load sensing technology. Light weight and easy to use, it has a single lever height adjustment and 3-in-1 operation for mulching, bagging, and discharging. Designed for durability and heavy duty jobs, it features a brushless motor that delivers the power and performance of a 160cc gas engine. With an extra battery on hand, you can now rip through grass in the neighborhood without the hassle of gas. Compatible batteries currently include a 2ah (model GBA80200) and 4ah (model GBA80400) battery and rapid charger (model GCH8040). The 2ah battery charges within 30 minutes so you can get back to work and finish that job. The 4ah battery charges within 1 hour.
feature_bullets: Your purchase includes: 21-Inch 80V Push Lawn Mower and 4.0AH battery and charger.
Up to 45 minutes of run time with fully charged 4Ah battery.
Brushless motors are more reliable and delivers gas equivalent performance to a 160cc gas engine.
Innovative Smart Cut Technology automatically increases the speed of the blade when more power is needed for the best cut possible.
3-In-1 design allows you to mulch, rear bag, or side discharge your grass clippings. Use up to 70% less space in your garage with the vertical storage feature.
Quiet operation and instant push button start.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,150 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
